intro: Wisteria japonica, commonly known as Japanese wisteria, is a deciduous climbing vine native to Japan. It is characterized by its long, pendulous clusters of fragrant, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has compound leaves composed of 12–20 oval-shaped leaflets. Its woody stems can grow up to 30 feet long, making it an impressive ornamental plant. Wisteria japonica thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often used in gardens and as a climbing plant for arbors and trellises.
